intro: Faramea phaneroura, commonly known as the showy faramea, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences that consist of clusters of small, brightly colored flowers. Faramea phaneroura typically grows as an erect shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests.
